verses.text: And it came to pass after \w this|strong="H0310"\w*, that \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w prepared|strong="H6213"\w* him \w chariots|strong="H4818"\w* and \w horses|strong="H5483"\w*, and \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w* to \w run|strong="H7323"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him.

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* rose up \w early|strong="H7925"\w*, and \w stood|strong="H5975"\w* \w beside|strong="H3027"\w* the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*: and it was \add so\add*, that when any \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that had a \w controversy|strong="H7379"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* for \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, then \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w called|strong="H7121"\w* unto him, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Of \w what|strong="H0335"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w* \add art\add* thou? And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \add is\add* of \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of the \w tribes|strong="H7626"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.\f + \fr 15.2 \ft came: Heb. to come\f*

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, \w See|strong="H7200"\w*, thy \w matters|strong="H1697"\w* \add are\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* and \w right|strong="H5228"\w*; but \add there is\add* no man \add deputed\add* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* to \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* thee.\f + \fr 15.3 \ft there…: or, none will hear thee from the king downward\f*

\w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* moreover, Oh that I were \w made|strong="H7760"\w* \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, that every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* which hath any \w suit|strong="H7379"\w* or \w cause|strong="H4941"\w* might \w come|strong="H0935"\w* unto me, and I would do him \w justice|strong="H6663"\w*!

And it was \add so\add*, that when any \w man|strong="H0376"\w* came \w nigh|strong="H7126"\w* \add to him\add* to do him \w obeisance|strong="H7812"\w*, he put \w forth|strong="H7971"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, and \w took|strong="H2388"\w* him, and \w kissed|strong="H5401"\w* him.

And on this \w manner|strong="H1697"\w* \w did|strong="H6213"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* to all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* that \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* for \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*: so \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w stole|strong="H1589"\w* the \w hearts|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass \w after|strong="H7093"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w*, that \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, I pray thee, let me \w go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w pay|strong="H7999"\w* my \w vow|strong="H5088"\w*, which I have \w vowed|strong="H5087"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, in \w Hebron|strong="H2275"\w*.

For thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w vowed|strong="H5087"\w* a \w vow|strong="H5088"\w* while I \w abode|strong="H3427"\w* at \w Geshur|strong="H1650"\w* in \w Syria|strong="H0758"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, If the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall bring me \w again|strong="H7725"\w* indeed to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, then I will \w serve|strong="H5647"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* in \w peace|strong="H7965"\w*. So he \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* to \w Hebron|strong="H2275"\w*.

¶ But \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w spies|strong="H7270"\w* throughout all the \w tribes|strong="H7626"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, As soon as ye \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* the \w sound|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w trumpet|strong="H7782"\w*, then ye shall \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w reigneth|strong="H4427"\w* in \w Hebron|strong="H2275"\w*.

And with \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w went|strong="H1980"\w* two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w* out of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, \add that were\add* \w called|strong="H7121"\w*; and they \w went|strong="H1980"\w* in their \w simplicity|strong="H8537"\w*, and they \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* not any \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*.

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* for \w Ahithophel|strong="H0302"\w* the \w Gilonite|strong="H1526"\w*, \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w counsellor|strong="H3289"\w*, from his \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, \add even\add* from \w Giloh|strong="H1542"\w*, while he \w offered|strong="H2076"\w* \w sacrifices|strong="H2077"\w*. And the \w conspiracy|strong="H7195"\w* was \w strong|strong="H0533"\w*; for the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w increased|strong="H7227"\w* \w continually|strong="H1980"\w* with \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.

¶ And there \w came|strong="H0935"\w* a \w messenger|strong="H5046"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, The \w hearts|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w men|strong="H0376"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* are \w after|strong="H0310"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto all his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* that \add were\add* with him at \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, \w Arise|strong="H6965"\w*, and let us \w flee|strong="H1272"\w*; for we shall not \add else\add* \w escape|strong="H6413"\w* \w from|strong="H6440"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*: make \w speed|strong="H4116"\w* to \w depart|strong="H3212"\w*, lest he \w overtake|strong="H5381"\w* us \w suddenly|strong="H4116"\w*, and \w bring|strong="H5080"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* upon us, and \w smite|strong="H5221"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* with the \w edge|strong="H6310"\w* of the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*.\f + \fr 15.14 \ft bring: Heb. thrust\f*

And the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Behold, thy \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \add are ready to do\add* whatsoever my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* shall \w appoint|strong="H0977"\w*.\f + \fr 15.15 \ft appoint: Heb. choose\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*, and all his \w household|strong="H1004"\w* \w after|strong="H7272"\w* him. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w left|strong="H5800"\w* \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, \add which were\add* \w concubines|strong="H6370"\w*, to \w keep|strong="H8104"\w* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.\f + \fr 15.16 \ft after…: Heb. at his feet\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* went \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*, and all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w after|strong="H7272"\w* him, and \w tarried|strong="H5975"\w* in a \w place|strong="H1004"\w* that was far \w off|strong="H4801"\w*.

And all his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* passed \w on|strong="H5674"\w* \w beside|strong="H3027"\w* him; and all the \w Cherethites|strong="H3774"\w*, and all the \w Pelethites|strong="H6432"\w*, and all the \w Gittites|strong="H1663"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w* which \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \w after|strong="H7272"\w* him from \w Gath|strong="H1661"\w*, passed \w on|strong="H5674"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

¶ Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* to \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w* the \w Gittite|strong="H1663"\w*, Wherefore \w goest|strong="H3212"\w* thou also with us? \w return|strong="H7725"\w* to thy \w place|strong="H4725"\w*, and \w abide|strong="H3427"\w* with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: for thou \add art\add* a \w stranger|strong="H5237"\w*, and also an \w exile|strong="H1540"\w*.

Whereas thou \w camest|strong="H0935"\w* \add but\add* \w yesterday|strong="H8543"\w*, should I this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* make thee \w go|strong="H3212"\w* up and \w down|strong="H5128"\w* with us? seeing I \w go|strong="H1980"\w* whither I may, \w return|strong="H7725"\w* thou, and take \w back|strong="H7725"\w* thy \w brethren|strong="H0251"\w*: \w mercy|strong="H2617"\w* and \w truth|strong="H0571"\w* \add be\add* with thee.\f + \fr 15.20 \ft go up…: Heb. wander in going\f*

And \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \add As\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w liveth|strong="H2416"\w*, and \add as\add* my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w liveth|strong="H2416"\w*, surely in what \w place|strong="H4725"\w* my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* shall be, whether in \w death|strong="H4194"\w* or \w life|strong="H2416"\w*, even there also will thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* be.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w*, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* and pass \w over|strong="H5674"\w*. And \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w* the \w Gittite|strong="H1663"\w* passed \w over|strong="H5674"\w*, and all his \w men|strong="H0582"\w*, and all the little \w ones|strong="H2945"\w* that \add were\add* with him.

And all the \w country|strong="H0776"\w* \w wept|strong="H1058"\w* with a \w loud|strong="H1419"\w* \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, and all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* passed \w over|strong="H5674"\w*: the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* also himself passed \w over|strong="H5674"\w* the \w brook|strong="H5158"\w* \w Kidron|strong="H6939"\w*, and all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* passed \w over|strong="H5674"\w*, \w toward|strong="H6440"\w* the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*.\f + \fr 15.23 \ft Kidron: Gr. Cedron\f*

¶ And lo \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* also, and all the \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w* \add were\add* with him, \w bearing|strong="H5375"\w* the \w ark|strong="H0727"\w* of the \w covenant|strong="H1285"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: and they set \w down|strong="H3332"\w* the \w ark|strong="H0727"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*; and \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w* went \w up|strong="H5927"\w*, until all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* had \w done|strong="H8552"\w* \w passing|strong="H5674"\w* out of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w*, Carry \w back|strong="H7725"\w* the \w ark|strong="H0727"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*: if I shall \w find|strong="H4672"\w* \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* in the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, he will bring me \w again|strong="H7725"\w*, and \w shew|strong="H7200"\w* me \add both\add* it, and his \w habitation|strong="H5116"\w*:

But if he thus \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, I have no \w delight|strong="H2654"\w* in thee; behold, \add here am\add* I, let him \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to me as \w seemeth|strong="H5869"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* unto him.

The \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* also unto \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* the \w priest|strong="H3548"\w*, \add Art not\add* thou a \w seer|strong="H7200"\w*? \w return|strong="H7725"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* in \w peace|strong="H7965"\w*, and your \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* with you, \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* thy \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, and \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w*.

\w See|strong="H7200"\w*, I will \w tarry|strong="H4102"\w* in the \w plain|strong="H6160"\w* of the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*, until there \w come|strong="H0935"\w* \w word|strong="H1697"\w* from you to \w certify|strong="H5046"\w* me.

\w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* therefore and \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w* \w carried|strong="H7725"\w* the \w ark|strong="H0727"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w again|strong="H7725"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*: and they \w tarried|strong="H3427"\w* there.

¶ And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* went \w up|strong="H5927"\w* by the \w ascent|strong="H4608"\w* of \add mount\add* \w Olivet|strong="H2132"\w*, and \w wept|strong="H1058"\w* as he went \w up|strong="H5927"\w*, and had his \w head|strong="H7218"\w* \w covered|strong="H2645"\w*, and he \w went|strong="H1980"\w* \w barefoot|strong="H3182"\w*: and all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \add was\add* with him \w covered|strong="H2645"\w* every \w man|strong="H0376"\w* his \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and they went \w up|strong="H5927"\w*, \w weeping|strong="H1058"\w* as they went \w up|strong="H5927"\w*.\f + \fr 15.30 \ft and wept…: Heb. going up and weeping\f*

¶ And \add one\add* \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Ahithophel|strong="H0302"\w* \add is\add* among the \w conspirators|strong="H7194"\w* with \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*. And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I pray thee, turn the \w counsel|strong="H6098"\w* of \w Ahithophel|strong="H0302"\w* into \w foolishness|strong="H5528"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass, that \add when\add* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* was \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* \add of the mount\add*, where he \w worshipped|strong="H7812"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, behold, \w Hushai|strong="H2365"\w* the \w Archite|strong="H0757"\w* came to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* him with his \w coat|strong="H3801"\w* \w rent|strong="H7167"\w*, and \w earth|strong="H0127"\w* upon his \w head|strong="H7218"\w*:
Unto whom \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, If thou passest \w on|strong="H5674"\w* with me, then thou shalt be a \w burden|strong="H4853"\w* unto me:

But if thou \w return|strong="H7725"\w* to the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, I will be thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; \add as\add* I \add have been\add* thy \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w hitherto|strong="H0227"\w*, so \add will\add* I now also \add be\add* thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*: then mayest thou for me \w defeat|strong="H6565"\w* the \w counsel|strong="H6098"\w* of \w Ahithophel|strong="H0302"\w*.

And \add hast thou\add* not there with thee \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* and \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w* the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*? therefore it shall be, \add that\add* what \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* soever thou shalt \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* out of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, thou shalt \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* \add it\add* to \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* and \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w* the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*.

Behold, \add they have\add* there with them their \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*, \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* \w Zadok’s|strong="H6659"\w* \add son\add*, and \w Jonathan|strong="H3083"\w* \w Abiathar’s|strong="H0054"\w* \add son;\add* and by \w them|strong="H3027"\w* ye shall \w send|strong="H7971"\w* unto me every \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* that ye can \w hear|strong="H8085"\w*.

So \w Hushai|strong="H2365"\w* \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w friend|strong="H7463"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* into \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.
